Restructuring Discontinue sales of non-qualified benefit plans funded by bank and corporate-
owned life insurance products (complete). 
Consolidate existing businesses in Louisville, Kentucky, and transfer operations to 
other existing locations in the United States (in process). 
Further consolidation and outsourcing of some back-office activities in 
Cedar Rapids, Iowa (in process). 
Possible divestment of AEGON’s Transamerica Re reinsurance activities in the 
United States and overseas. 
Run-off of AEGON’s spread-based institutional market division in the United States 
(announced in 2009).
Objectives Reduce operating costs and further improve efficiency (AEGON expects the 
measures will result in annual cost savings of approximately USD 70 million).
Employees affected Loss of approximately 500 jobs in the United States, equivalent to 5% of the 
company’s total US workforce. 
Measures taken, where 
possible, to limit number of 
compulsory redundanciesNumber of steps taken before the start of the restructuring program to limit job 
losses in light of economic downturn, including: 
	Reduction in payroll expenses. 
	Hiring and salary freezes in certain areas. 
	Reduction in other, non-payroll costs. 
	Employees offered opportunities to move to other positions, where possible, 
within the organization. 
Measures taken to support 
employees affected by 
redundancyOutplacement service, operated by external company, providing careers advice, 
counseling, and skill development programs (employees eligible for program for up 
to six months after severance). 
Redundancy packages linked to length of service. 
Selected employees offered relocation package to move to other AEGON locations 
in the United States.
Internal communications and 
consultation proceduresDirect communications to employees and business units affected. 
Internal communications program via email, newsletter and intranet. 
Counseling and advice available as part of outplacement service.
